author: just2good
title: Great Set!
review:
This set is awsome!
Pros:
4 minifigs
Bench
Signs
Blonde Hair
Box
On $10
Cons:
Nothing!
At Target (where I got this), they had alot of 09' sets! 
Also, this was a great deal, as it was only $10!

author: legomakes3
title: It is a Cool Set!
review:
I just bought this set at my local Target and it is a great $10 set. TARGET has some great 09 sets already in stock!

Pros:

*Boosts up your collection of mini-figs
*Fun things to build (including a boom box and a bench)
*Hair! (It is my first piece of LEGO air in my collection!)

Cons:

*I'm not a big fan of stickers.

Overall, this collection is the bomb! :)

author: jpmanalo
title: The Town Minifig Pack Is Back!
review:
Many people have been hoping to see the LEGO Group release a Town minifig pack for a long time, and the LEGO Group has delivered with set 8401. 
 
 
Features of set 8401 include: 
 
* Street Signs: 
Street signs are made up from stickers, (compare against set 5612 where the street sign is *printed* on the piece). 

Some people may like this, as it allows them to create their own stickers, whereas other people prefer printed pieces as it means they don't need to 'fiddle-around' with stickers. 

* Minifigs and Accessories: 
Good assortment of minifigs - set includes a male policeman, a delivery-man, a business-man, and one female 'fig. 

Fans of Classic-Space (SPACE!) will appreciate the torso design for the delivery-man, as it features a jacket with a Classic-Space logo. 
 
The minfig accessories include: 
    -- A black megaphone and walkie-talkie for the policeman 
    -- A brown briefcase for the business-man 
    -- A red hand-cart, a brown box (with lid), and a yellow cup for the delivery-man 
    -- A brick-built portable sound-system for the female minifig 

* Other items: 
A fire hydrant and a bench - nice little items to add to a town layout. 
 
 
In summary, fans of Town / City will really appreciate this set, and other LEGO enthusiasts will find elements within this set useful in their creations. 

As at 16 January 2009, this set retails in Australia for AUD $14.95 from Target, K-Mart, and Myer. LEGO Shop@Home has this set for AUD$14.99. 
 
-- J.P. Manalo

author: zidane
title: Great set, great minifigs
review:
I could`t resist to buy this set. It is small but minifigs are just too great! 

Girl with blond hair is really cool and I agree is rare minifing. All figures except cop are very nice, and I thing that this set could be even better if plan civilian was in the set instead of cop. There are already many sets with cops, but I`m giving highest rate 5+!

It was 8 EUR when I bought it. I think it is reasonable price for 4 minifigs and great accessories.

author: villicus
title: Just wonderful!
review: This set contains 4 figures, a girl and three guys, and offers some tools you can easily use to improve your city. design of the figs is nice and detailed, and for you older guys around, the delivery man has a small classic space logo on his jacket! The nowadays children might not see that hint to lego history. Thanks lego for that little detail. Get this set, its worth it.

author: lotographia
title: Debbie, Fred, Derek and Officer Fernandez.
review:
I haven't bothered with the city sets in quite some time. If I had, I'm quite sure I'd end up with a city composed entirely of police, fire and rescue vehicles and buildings with the occasional city maintenance vehicle or service station thrown in. And maybe a token civilian to be rescued or assisted by any of the above.

This year seems to be set to change that trend. There's a farm, a horse and trailer, a camper, a sports car, a bus and some shops. Finally! A lego city that actually looks like a city! To be exact, a city with surrounding farmland.

The civilian to policeman ratio in this set is what all lego should ideally be like - the police presence shouldn't completely overwhelm the society. Hopefully the lego company will start making a more proportionally realistic society from now on.

This is my first city set for the year, and it provides me with a mix of citizens, accessories and municipal features. I am happy.

author: hustla187
title: Great Addition to Any Lego City
review: I got this set for Easter, and I really like this set alot. I like the traffic signals and the signs are good too. However, the stickers are annoying as always. The stereo is very cool and the bench is just perfect. Overall, I have to say this is a great set.

author: Noah1997
title: great for any city
review:
this lego set is awesome! it comes with a girl and a tape deck the drink is cool to the business man's suitcase is pretty nice it comes with cool dark brown hair and a blond ponytail the police man is great
the signs are OK over all I would give this set a 5/5

author: Buckbrick
title: All about minifigs
review:
This is a great minifig set to either supplement your city/town, or custom some minifigs for other purposes. For example, put the businessman with the handcart, plop the briefcase on it and you have a concierge/porter for your Cafe Corner hotel - at least that was what I did :)

The girl is a nice addition with with her sleeveless top and blond hairdo. The policeman however is a dime a dozen, and one can get tired of too many of variations of these fellas.

All in all, you do not get many of such sets - larger than a single impulse set, but substantial enough to be useful.

author: indykid
title: Really Good
review:
You may think I talk to good about every set I have, but that's because I've never been disappointed by LEGO. That sounded really cliche. But nevermind, I'm supposed to be talking about this great set. It's good for adding signs, benches and citizens to your LEGO town.

Minifigures: The majority of this set. There are four in all. Surfer girl, Delivery boy (even though he doesn't really look like a boy, he looks like a man; i guess delivering too many packages makes you age badly.), Guy in a suit, Police Man

Accessories: Boom box for surfer girl, Coffee Mug for Delivery Boy/Man, Brown briefcase for the guy in a suit, Radio and Megaphone for Police Man. 

City Accessories: Crate with red carrier, Bench, very similar to the bench in Cafe Corner but one of the planks has studs so the Minifigs sit more easily in it, Signs like the Crosswalk sign, Speed Limit Sign, and Street light sign, Street light, and Fire hydrant. 

Build: Easy Build. Very few pieces. You put together like 4 pieces and you're almost finished. that was a joke.

Playability: Tons of playability. 

Overall: 8.7/10. Could have come with a few more accessories or even people but it should have come with a car and/or a road plate. I still like this set and it is fun to add to the 'Camper' set to have a dance party BBQ. It's also very cheap for so many figures.

author: Teez
title: Great addition to any Lego city!
review: If you're like me and keep the minifigs that come with sets inside the set itself (eg, drivers in vehicles) your Lego city will look like a ghost town. City Minifigure Collection to the rescue! Each of these four minifigs comes with appropriate gear and they can be used nearly anywhere in your Lego city without looking out of place. This set also includes three street signs, a traffic signal, fire hydrant and park bench. The delivery man has a dolly & box, the cop a walkie-talkie and loudspeaker, the businessman a briefcase and coffee mug and the female a boom box (radio). This is a reasonably-priced set that enhances any Lego city or collection.

author: kaboomlegoman
title: minifigure collection. only four minifigs.
review: Um,what in the world are just four minifigures doing in this set.It said it was a minifigure collection. this set is nice but only four minifigures in a minifigure collection. Buy this set only if you like sets that don't follow their title, or if you like street signs. Overall, nice set but something tells me you shouldn't get it. Or if you want to you can.

author: galonschiente
title: good but...
review:
I got this set a couple of months ago. I think the minifigs are cool but there should have been a base plate to connect it all. Bench was a nice touch and boombox too. anyways this set is a great addition to a lego city and every lego city needs a good policeman!
smell ya later!

author: ethanistherock
title: Bad set
review:
Pros

4 minifigs
Stoplight
Radio

Cons

STICKERS! There are simply to many stickers for this set 3 to be exact most sets like this have NO stickers (unless it's a police) 

Still the stoplight makes it a sure addition to any city so if I were you I'd cough up ten bucks and buy this great set.

IT IS A SIMPLE BUILD

author: Exo_brick
title: Great
review:
I bought this set so I didn't have to have star wars guys as civilians. I like that it comes with four minifigs for $10. Time to break it down:

Section 1: People
      Subsection 1: Police Officer
            Not much new here. Just another police officer. This is my eighth officer.
      Good for a town with no police.
      Subsection 2:Girl
            A nice figure, with a good color scheme. The shirt is one I didn't have,
      so thats nice.
      Subsection 3: Delivery man
            This guy looks like a jerk. He looks like he'd be on a rocking chair
      saying "You darn kids, get off my lawn!" Always a welcome person, one who
      is in the delivery system.
      Subsection 4: Business man
            Nice fellow, seems good for a corperate worker.
Section 2: Items and signs
      Subsection 1: Items
            The bench is a nice addition. A fire hydrant is essential. The radio is
      awesome for a kid. The hand truck is great; you can never have enough.
      Subsection 2: Signs
            A few nice signs and the trafic light is cool.

Conclusion: A nice set great for boosting residents.

*What did you think of the section/subsection system? It would be better for larger sets. Use the "Was this review useful button" to reply. Yes for good, No for complete failure.

author: Jcc2224
title: Many firsts
review: This set had many firsts to it(to me)cops face, mans head, hair, and torso(light flesh neck,:( ) Mail mans hat, and torso, and womans torso and hair, I enjoy these new parts of mine, and they rock, the figs are nice, everything else is too, not much to talk about beacuse there isn't much in it, but if you like figs, get it, it's worth it.

author: Lint
title: Nice city supplement
review:
I had been eyeing this set since it was first released but wasn't too keen on price. I eventually ended up picking it up on clearance. This is a basic set which comes with four minifigs and a whole bunch of decorations for your lego city.

PROS

  • Park bench is great
  • All the other accessories are relevant and useful in a city (except maybe the boombox). Signage is particularly welcome.
  • Good amount of spare studs

CONS

  • Nonsense building experience
  • Minifigs are pretty average
  • The cop is kind of rubbish and you can get plenty of policemen from Police themed sets. Why not another civilian minifig for variety? After all most people would be buying this set to add to their civilian count.

Overall this set is an average buy. It's definitely worth picking up on a sale or on clearance and is very useful if you are a city builder and need signage and other doodads to decorate your city with. Stand alone, there is little play value here.

author: alva
title: City BattlePack
review:
This set is what I called a City BattlePack. Other themes, such as kingdom, starwars, always have the battle pack and this set is fulfill the definition of battle pack. It contains mainly minifigures with some parts serving as equipment.

The minifigs (with exception the police minifig) are really lovely. Love the classic design of the female minifig.

I love the fire hydrant, traffic light and the traffic signs that come with this set, since it will really improve my Lego city to look more city. I mean, what kind of city that doesnt have any of these item?

The design of the park bench also quite lovely. It really realistic looking. My only complaint here is that the minifig can not sit tightly in this bench. But this is easily fixed by changing the brown tile into brown plate.

I think Lego should launch more of this kind of set for city, since the minifigs will work best as civilians in Lego city. All of them should be dressed as civilian, so remove the police, cause if people want a police minifig, they can find them easily in any police themed set.

author: Harm1
title: Terrible set
review:
This is one of the worst sets ever. 

All the figs and parts can easily be found elsewhere, except for the traffic signs, which are horrible. Lego has produced lovely signs in the past that looked way better then these and didn't come with the ugly stickers. 

Also, this set is supposed to bring variation by introducing more citizens in your collection, so why on earth would you include another policeman. 

This, together with the terrible price, makes it a very bad set. Don't waste your money on this one.

author: brixton
title: A Must Have
review: If you are building a lego city than this is a must have.  It comes with 4 minifigures, a boom box, brief case, street signs and much more.  The bench is absolutely great.  Since it is the minifigure collection I was hoping for more street lights and minifigures.  I only bought this to make my city look a bit more busy with people around and to put some in buildings and the train.

author: legospongepotter
title: Mostly for Minifigures
review: I only got this set because I didn't have many Minifigures. IT's full of a bunch of pieces that make it nearly impossible to play with. The minifigures made it worth it, though. The Businessman and his suitcase was a great addition to my collection. The girl with the ponytail was also good since I mainly have male Minifigures. Her hairpiece was also good. The policeman was a nice touch because I don't have any of those as I collect Spongebob Lego Sets. The delivery man is cool and his torso piece and his head's grimace reminds me of some criminal. Overall a pretty good set that is great for the people

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Lots Of Busy-Busy
review:
As a reviewer that prefers models and builds to, in my humble opinion, over numerous minifigures, this set was surprisingly almost a gem. 

Minifigures:
  • Stereo girl gets blue jeans, a flowery top and blond hair with a pony tail. Oh and a stereo of course that must be built- excellent.
  • A bespectacled, bearded businessman comes with his grey trousers, waistcoat and tie top, goatee beard and brown hair. Don't let him forget his briefcase.
  • A slightly grouching delivery guy gets beige combats and a red classic space fan jacket. With red cap he is ready to push a trolley and box around while drinking a beverage from his yellow mug.
  • Contender for most dour minifigure ever is the Policeman. He gets an impeccable uniform and badge print on black of course with a white flat cap, holding a cb radio and megaphone. Where's the dog?
City Centre
A childhood favourite for pocket money, the people sets for any theme are usually really good but without money for many buildings or interactive models, the small town can get a bit over populated.

What makes this set great is the extra stuff you get and is one of the most satisfying builds for such small pieces and models; street signs, fire hydrant, traffic lights, wagon and box, stereo and the sturdy bench. All these are neat little models and extras for a setting and makes one expect more in similar sets and themes, mini-builds to go with and better justify the minifigure. These quick builds are pretty inspired with really good minifigure prints.

As a purist, I'm not keen on the eye highlights and various expressions but the policeman's moustache is certainly different and the glasses and shades are again a good variant. A dog would have been a choice extra but as it goes the businessman is amusing and the best brick is of course the guy with the red cap- his space theme jacket!

Bustle
Mix and match of course provides an alternative, personalised range of people. The elements here are really satisfying and small builds such as the bench, stereo and traffic lights just bring bricks back in to a minifigure set to make an excellent achievement: A set that combines theme accessories, characters and a scene.

author: AETerry
title: City Minifigure Collection Review
review:
This is a set I picked up for the minifigures and accessories. And it's a good addition to a LEGO Town or City for the variety of minifigures and elements to flesh out the streets and business of city life and people out and about.

Instructions

The instructions are in booklet form and follow LEGO's clear step-by-step illustrations.

Parts

There's a total of 60 pieces to this set, most of which lend themselves towards signs and various mini builds within the set.

Minifigures

There are a total of four minifigures in this set. A delivery guy with a trolley, a gal with a radio, office worker on his way somewhere and a police officer. Now, personally, with the number of Police sets that come out and get done, I'd have changed out the police minifigure to another city type minifigure. Even a second female figure in this set.

The build and completed model

There's not much of a build to this set, as much of it is assembling the street signs and then small minibuilds for a Street Light, sidewalk bench, fire hydrant and a portable radio.

Summary

Still, while the set comes across as really simple, it's a great set for all of it's minibuilds with detailing out a larger LEGO City or Town. Or just even for the minifigures themselves to add variety to a collection and MOC building. There are good elements and pieces here, it's all a matter of if you're into LEGO City or are looking for specific needs with other builds.

author: Doctor_Leg_O_Brick
title: A great add on to a city
review:
Well, this set quite a nice to add to a city, even if you have some of the 70s/80s sign posts this is sill great.

 

THE BUILD

Easily built in one or two minutes. You get a 13 (15 if you include the advert and parts list) page instruction book.

 

THE PARTS

I was a little bit sad about that the signs that are NOT printed like the old ones did but im not going to moan. You get pieces to build a fire hydrant, bench, boombox or radio, police gear, trolly, box, the signs, a mug, briefcase or suitcase, traffic light and of course, 4 minifigures.

 

THE PLAYABILITY

I had to give it a three because with out a city, this set would go the way of the parts bin. If you are making a city, get this. If you have a city, get this. If you are making a city MOC, get this. If you don't collect city, don't get this.

 

THE MINIFIGURES

You get a women with a pig tail, a body with flowers on, used alot these days in city/town sets and plain dark blue legs. Also, a police officer with a police body and white cap. The head for the cop is that of uncle Vernon from 4728. The delivery boy (more like a man to me!) has tan legs, red coat with the space logo on and new baseball cap. Business man has a city head, brown hair, light grey legs and a LIGHT FLESH body from 4855.

 

THE MONEY

Allright for Â£6.99.

 

THE OVERALL RATING 

It had to have a four because of the problems with the signs.

Thanks for reading.

DR.L.O.B

author: modena
title: Rare parts!
review:
This set is a fantastic addition to a Lego city street.

The SIGNS:

The signs were really great, they really helped to fill up an empty street.

The FIGURES:

The figures were really nice, and this set will do if you want a police officer without something big.

The ACCESSORIES:

The accessories were really nice: a cup, a radio, a walkie-talkie, a suitcase, A fire pump... Everything was great!

Pros:

  • Rare figures!
  • Great Accessories!
  • Nice signs!
  • A bench!
  • A cup!

Cons:

  • Not much building.

Overall:

This is a very good addition to a street, and I was really overjoyed by the accessories.
So get this set if you need to fill up your street with lots of stuff!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Citizens Daily Grind
review:
Set #8401 City Mini-Figure Collection: This set is a small set, but it's in a box that seems to me to be a tad largeish for what you get inside. On top of that most stores in Canada have raised the price by one dollar compared to the 12.99$ price I paid for it last year. I can't understand that policy personally, in fact this set to me should have been 9.99$ for what you're getting.

 

There aren't a lot of pieces in it, and what is there isn't much, basically you're using a lot of small pieces to build up the following items. A School Crossing sign, a Stoplight, A Warning Stoplight Ahead sign, a fire hydrant, a park/bus stop bench, a speed limit sign, a boom box for the female mini-figure. You also get a walkie talkie and megaphone for the police officer, a briefcase for the office worker, a little yellow mug (probably for coffee) for the deliveryman and one of those wheeled delivery thingies to hold the crate.

 

All in all I can't hate this set, but I can't downright praise it either, considering that back in the 90's Mini-Figure collections involved the same sort of design, but cost considerably less I find that there should just be something more for the price I'm paying. True I am aware of inflation and such, but this set is still shelfwarming around because in my opinion it just costs too much for what you're getting.

 

Don't get me wrong though, if you want to populate your LEGO City with more people it's a must have set, in fact this set plus City Corner would look pretty good together I'd bet (not having obtained that set I can't say 100% for certain.) and if you did get it on sale or during one of the infamous buy one get one deals than great. But if you are going to buy it at least buy a few other actual sets from the City theme to go with it, as a stand alone set I think we AFOLs appreciate it more for the nostalgia of purchasing a Mini-Figure collection again. At least the bench is useful for holding my Santa Key Chain when I'm displaying all my sets. :D

author: av8r1973
title: A little overpriced, but a nice way to populate your city
review:
This finally ended up on a shelf here in Taiwan, so I picked it up.  As another reviewer thought - big box.  A bit too big.  Especially for the premium charged for it USD13.75.  I typically complain about stickers, and this set has a couple.  At least mine was supposed to.  The entire sticker sheet was missing (not just wrinkled up, but missing).  I will be visiting LEGO customer service later tonight.

With the negatives out of the way, it really is a nice little set.  I really like the stop lights.  I am going to have to figure out how to order parts for another dozen or two.  They are nice additions to my Cityscape.  The fire hydrant matches the one in the City House - good to keep them looking similar.  The signs help make the city more realistic (they will when I get the stickers).

The minifigs are great.  Another policeman, but with a nice scowl, megaphone, and walkie-talkie accessory.  His hat is a nice crisp dress hat, rather than a ballcap or helmet.  Not bad - he plays the traffic cop look well.  The blonde with the boombox is nice, though it's about time LEGO updates the old cassette tape into something a bit more modern.  A boombox?  How about an MP3 player?  Or a cell phone?  The businessman with a briefcase is nice, and the worker is nice.  He has a nice smirk and the red glasses. I managed to get him to hold onto the cup and the handtruck at the same time. True multitasking.

To justify the price, I wish there had been at least a streetlamp (to match the nice City variety in other sets).  Two would have sealed the deal.

If you are looking to build out your accessories and populate the streets, this is a nice set to do that with.  Perhaps a couple are needed.  Try to get it on sale.

author: BrickTVReviews
title: It's Boring At First But......
review:
Its GREAT! Welcome again and we have set 8401 CITY MINIFIGURE COLLECTION, YES IT'S GREAT! With 4 minifigs his will really BOOM UP YOUR TOWN!

 

Parts

                                             Great parts you get A LOT of pieces like the 4X4 slope brick for the bench and hinges, the street signs, megaphone and walkie-talkie.

 

Minifigures

                                             The 4 minifigures are a police officer, a business man with briefcase, a female civilian with radio, and a male civilian with a yellow cup and dolly with brown box.

 

Model

                                             There is a fire hydrant, bench, street signs, and 4 minigures, none are special

 

Story Corner

                                             This is a new feature intended for KFOL [Kid Fans Of LEGO] readers of Brickset although AFOL [Im sure all of you has heard of it] could read this part too [Im pretty old and still loves [maybe] this part too]. I bought this because of the police officer and I made in on my way home IN THE CAR AT NIGHT and turned out boring. Not when I received the 3182 Airport [check out my review of it] and started brickfilming this is great!

 

Conclusion

                                            You'll feel sorry if you missed this set 10-10 :}

author: WoutStopmotion
title: Generic Stuff
review:
I got this set quite a while ago because i wanted some parts included in it.

Building Experience

Not a lot of it. You get to build up a few figures and some very simple accessories. I don't really think there's anything else i can say about building.

Parts

Let's talk about the figures. I really wanted the head of the policeman, so that's a main reason why i got this set. The other figure parts... meh. They're your typical City minifigs, which you can expect, but generally they're kinda boring. And, mine were very badly printed. Some of the faces were overly contrasted, and some torsos aswell. Besides that you also get accessories, which include a bench, boombox, fire hydrant and some other stuff. The parts aren't very special, and to top it you also need to sticker the signs. Eww.

Playability

I don't see a lot of playability, but if you'd build a city, you could add these minifigs and signs to them to play. That's it, really.

Value for Money

The price seems just a bit too high for the pieces you get, but besides that i think it's OK.

Overall Rating

This set is very simple and doesn't contain a lot, unless you like minifigs and stickers. And there's plenty of people that like those, so for them, that's why this set gets the middle rating from me, a three.

author: Mask_of_Control
title: One of the best and cheap ways to improve a Lego City!
review:
I receive this set in 2009 and I think it's a very good way to improve a Lego City.

Pros

» Many good minifigures.

» Good and useful accessories.

» This set is a cheap way to improve a Lego City.

Cons

» Nothing.

Conclusion:

This set is a cheaper and easy way to improve a Lego City and I definitively recommend buying this set if you are building or improving a Lego City.

Set score

10/10
